DOC.detailed_description: At term 2 3 % singleton pregnancy breech presentation . Many delivery manage cesarean delivery due high neonatal morbidity associate vaginal breech delivery . However , cesarean delivery , safe option baby , associate high incidence maternal complication current subsequent pregnancy . External cephalic version ( ECV ) procedure commonly use attempt manually rotate fetus vertex position . This facilitate vaginal delivery thus avoid high maternal and/or neonatal complication . ( Hofmeyr Cochrane Review ) Obstetricians generally perform version 36 week gestational age reportable success rate 50-80 % , depend several factor , include patient characteristic . ( Fortunato , Zhang , ACOG 1997 ECV ) The common technique involve external manipulation fetal position precede pharmacologic uterine relaxation . Until recently , pain relief generally provide form intravenous opioids fentanyl . A efficacious form analgesia use neuraxial opioids local anesthetic ( neuraxial analgesia ) , technique commonly use labor delivery analgesia . Two non-randomized study neuraxial analgesia compare systemic analgesia find improved success external cephalic version neuraxial analgesia group . ( Carlan , Birnbach ) Three randomize trial conflict result : 2 demonstrate increase success , one show difference . ( Dugoff , Schorr , Mancuso ) None study blind obstetrician perform version . In 2010 , Lavoie colleague complete meta-analysis look ECV perform analgesic anesthetic neuraxial dos . The analgesic dose include spinal bupivacaine epidural dosing . The anesthestic group give high dos spinal epidural bupivacaine . This meta-analysis suggest patient receive anesthetic dose successful ECV . All publish study examine pain outcomes demonstrate neuraxial analgesia result great patient comfort procedure . The American College Obstetricians Gynecologists ( ACOG ) state , `` Currently enough evidence make recommendation favor oppose anesthesia ECV ( external cephalic version ) attempt . ''
